meanings.definition: A public road in a city or town, typically with buildings on either side.
meanings.sent1: I walked down the street to get to the store.
meanings.sent2: The street was busy with cars and people.
meanings.sent3: The street seemed to be in a hurry, bustling with activity.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a street filled with memories, some bright and some dark.
meanings.sent5: The street was lined with colorful houses, creating a picturesque scene.

meanings.definition: The roadway of a street, especially as distinguished from the sidewalk.
meanings.sent1: The street was paved with smooth asphalt.
meanings.sent2: He rode his bike on the street instead of the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The street felt left out as everyone walked on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: The street stretched out like a black ribbon under the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The street gleamed under the streetlights, guiding the way home.

meanings.definition: A row of houses or buildings on one or both sides of a road.
meanings.sent1: The street was lined with quaint cottages.
meanings.sent2: She admired the architecture of the buildings on the street.
meanings.sent3: The street whispered secrets of the families living in the houses.
meanings.sent4: The street resembled a colorful mosaic of different homes.
meanings.sent5: The street was a gallery of unique buildings, each telling its own story.
